Details: In eastern Logar province, gunmen shot and killed a deputy chief of a provincial clerical council, said Gen. Esmatullah Alizia, the Logar police chief.[141]

Location: <img alt="Afghanistan" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/9a/Flag_of_Afghanistan.svg/23px-Flag_of_Afghanistan.svg.png" width="23" height="15" class="thumbborder" data-file-width="600" data-file-height="400"> Kandahar Province, Afghanistan
Details: 11 Afghan National Army soldiers were killed and nine others wounded in a Taliban attack on a military base in Kandahar.[142]

Location: <img alt="Syria" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/53/Flag_of_Syria.svg/23px-Flag_of_Syria.svg.png" width="23" height="15" class="thumbborder" data-file-width="900" data-file-height="600"> Homs, Syria
Details: A car bombing in the city of Homs on Tuesday morning, Syrian state television said, two days after the city went back under full government control for the first time since 2011. At least 4 four people were killed and other 32 were injured in Homs on Tuesday morning, Syrian state television said, two days after the city went back under full government control for the first time since 2011.[143][144]

Location: <img alt="Syria" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/53/Flag_of_Syria.svg/23px-Flag_of_Syria.svg.png" width="23" height="15" class="thumbborder" data-file-width="900" data-file-height="600"> Damascus, Syria
Details: Another bomb detonated in the capital of Damascus on the road to the airport, as the human rights activist explained. According to Sana, government troops at a checkpoint stopped an explosive loaded vehicle.[143]

Location: <img alt="Somalia" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a0/Flag_of_Somalia.svg/23px-Flag_of_Somalia.svg.png" width="23" height="15" class="thumbborder" data-file-width="900" data-file-height="600"> Bosaso, Somalia
Details: A suicide attack in the North East of Somalia killed at least five people. More than nine people were injured in the attack on a checkpoint in the city of Bosaso in Puntland, a police officer said. Two of the dead were security forces. The terrorist "Islamic State" claimed the attack on Wednesday for itself.[145]

Location: <img alt="Thailand" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a9/Flag_of_Thailand.svg/23px-Flag_of_Thailand.svg.png" width="23" height="15" class="thumbborder" data-file-width="900" data-file-height="600"> Hat Yai, Thailand
Details: Attackers in southern Thailand fatally shot two army rangers at close range Tuesday, police said, the latest killings in a region that has been plagued by a long-running Muslim separatist insurgency.[146]

Location: <img alt="Mali" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/92/Flag_of_Mali.svg/23px-Flag_of_Mali.svg.png" width="23" height="15" class="thumbborder" data-file-width="450" data-file-height="300"> Kidal region, Mali
Details: Two peacekeepers of the United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (MINUSMA) were killed and another injured on Tuesday morning in an ambush in the northern Kidal region.[147]

Location: <img alt="Indonesia" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/9f/Flag_of_Indonesia.svg/23px-Flag_of_Indonesia.svg.png" width="23" height="15" class="thumbborder" data-file-width="450" data-file-height="300"> Jakarta, Indonesia
Details: 2017 Jakarta bombings: Three police officers were killed and ten others, five police officers and five civilians, injured when two suicide bombers blew themself up at a bus stop in Jakarta. The police confirmed that the bombers were members of Jamaah Ansharut Tauhid, a group linked to Islamic State.[148][149]

Location: <img alt="Somalia" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a0/Flag_of_Somalia.svg/23px-Flag_of_Somalia.svg.png" width="23" height="15" class="thumbborder" data-file-width="900" data-file-height="600"> Mogadishu, Somalia
Details: A bombing claimed by Islamist insurgents killed five civilians and injured six more in the Somali capital on Wednesday, a spokesman for the city's mayor said, underscoring the militants' ability to carry out attacks despite territorial losses.[150]
Part of: Spillover of the War in Somalia

Location: <img alt="Pakistan" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/32/Flag_of_Pakistan.svg/23px-Flag_of_Pakistan.svg.png" width="23" height="15" class="thumbborder" data-file-width="900" data-file-height="600"> Quetta, Pakistan
Details: Two Chinese teachers were kidnapped from the Jinnah Town area of the provincial capital of Balochistan on Wednesday afternoon while another Chinese national reportedly escaped the abduction.[151]

Location: <img alt="India" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/4/41/Flag_of_India.svg/23px-Flag_of_India.svg.png" width="23" height="15" class="thumbborder" data-file-width="1350" data-file-height="900"> Srinagar, India
Details: A block president of People’s Democratic Party (PDP) was critically injured as militants fired at him this evening in Barzulla area of Srinagar.[152]

Location: <img alt="Kenya" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/49/Flag_of_Kenya.svg/23px-Flag_of_Kenya.svg.png" width="23" height="15" class="thumbborder" data-file-width="900" data-file-height="600"> Liboi, Kenya
Details: Four policemen were killed in an attack in the north-east of Kenya. The officials were on a Wednesday morning at Liboi near the border with Somalia with a vehicle over an explosive body. Another policeman had been injured.[153][154]
Part of: Spillover of the War in Somalia

Location: <img alt="Kenya" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/49/Flag_of_Kenya.svg/23px-Flag_of_Kenya.svg.png" width="23" height="15" class="thumbborder" data-file-width="900" data-file-height="600"> Liboi, Kenya
Details: Two policemen were killed and two others were injured when a bomb planted by Al-Shabaab militants blew up in the north-east of Kenya.[155][156]

Location: <img alt="Egypt" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/fe/Flag_of_Egypt.svg/23px-Flag_of_Egypt.svg.png" width="23" height="15" class="thumbborder" data-file-width="900" data-file-height="600"> Arish, Egypt
Details: An Egyptian policeman was shot dead by militants in the northern Sinai Peninsula.[157]

Location: <img alt="Greece" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/5c/Flag_of_Greece.svg/23px-Flag_of_Greece.svg.png" width="23" height="15" class="thumbborder" data-file-width="600" data-file-height="400"> Athens, Greece
Details: The former Prime Minister of Greece Lucas Papademos and his driver were injured after bomb exploded inside his car in Athens. The group Conspiracy of Fire Nuclei said they carried out the attack.[158]

Location: <img alt="Philippines" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/99/Flag_of_the_Philippines.svg/23px-Flag_of_the_Philippines.svg.png" width="23" height="12" class="thumbborder" data-file-width="900" data-file-height="450"> Sulu, Philippines
Details: One soldier was killed and 10 others were wounded in a pre-dawn ambush staged by Abu Sayyaf militants in Patikul, Sulu, a Mindanao-based military official said Thursday.[159]

Location: <img alt="Kenya" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/49/Flag_of_Kenya.svg/23px-Flag_of_Kenya.svg.png" width="23" height="15" class="thumbborder" data-file-width="900" data-file-height="600"> Garissa County, Kenya
Details: A roadside bomb planted by Somali Islamists killed two Kenyan police near the Somali border on Thursday, police said, bringing to 11 the number of Kenyan security officials that have been killed by roadside bombs over the past two days.[160]

Location: <img alt="Egypt" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/fe/Flag_of_Egypt.svg/23px-Flag_of_Egypt.svg.png" width="23" height="15" class="thumbborder" data-file-width="900" data-file-height="600"> Minya, Egypt
Details: 2017 Minya attack: 28 people have been killed and 25 wounded after gunmen opened fire on a bus carrying Coptic Christians in central Egypt.[161][162]

Location: <img alt="Afghanistan" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/9a/Flag_of_Afghanistan.svg/23px-Flag_of_Afghanistan.svg.png" width="23" height="15" class="thumbborder" data-file-width="600" data-file-height="400"> Shah Wali Kot District, Afghanistan
Details: 15 Afghan soldiers were killed & 5 wounded after a Taliban attack on a military base in Shah Wali Kot District, Kandahar province.[163]

Location: <img alt="Afghanistan" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/9a/Flag_of_Afghanistan.svg/23px-Flag_of_Afghanistan.svg.png" width="23" height="15" class="thumbborder" data-file-width="600" data-file-height="400"> Khost, Afghanistan
Details: A suicide car bomber targeted police vehicles in the centre of Khost, Khost Province. The attack killed 13 and wounded 2 others.[164]

Location: <img alt="United Kingdom" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/a/ae/Flag_of_the_United_Kingdom.svg/23px-Flag_of_the_United_Kingdom.svg.png" width="23" height="12" class="thumbborder" data-file-width="1200" data-file-height="600"> Bangor, Northern Ireland
Details: A man was killed after being shot outside a supermarket car park in Bangor. The Police Service of Northern Ireland said that the man may have been linked to a feud with loyalist paramilitary factions.[165][166]

Location: <img alt="Iran" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/ca/Flag_of_Iran.svg/23px-Flag_of_Iran.svg.png" width="23" height="13" class="thumbborder" data-file-width="630" data-file-height="360"> Western Azerbaijan, Iran
Details: Two Iranian border guards have been killed and five others have been injured in a clash with members of PJAK, a branch of the PKK party, in western Azerbaijan province bordering Turkey, officials said.[167][168]

Location: <img alt="Iraq" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/f6/Flag_of_Iraq.svg/23px-Flag_of_Iraq.svg.png" width="23" height="15" class="thumbborder" data-file-width="411" data-file-height="274"> Baghdad, Iraq
Details: Al-Faqma ice cream parlor bombing: At least 30 people were killed and 40 more injured when a car bomb detonated while they were outside an ice cream shop. ISIS claimed responsibility.[169]

Location: <img alt="Peru" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/cf/Flag_of_Peru.svg/23px-Flag_of_Peru.svg.png" width="23" height="15" class="thumbborder" data-file-width="900" data-file-height="600"> Ayacucho, Peru
Details: According to Channel N, it would be a narco-terrorist attack in which two members of the National Police of Peru were shot dead in the VRAEM region.[170]

Location: <img alt="Colombia" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/21/Flag_of_Colombia.svg/23px-Flag_of_Colombia.svg.png" width="23" height="15" class="thumbborder" data-file-width="450" data-file-height="300"> Antioquia Department, Colombia
Details: A Colombian policeman died today and two more were wounded in an attack by the guerrillas of the National Liberation Army on a road in the department of Antioquia[171]

Location: <img alt="Afghanistan" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/9a/Flag_of_Afghanistan.svg/23px-Flag_of_Afghanistan.svg.png" width="23" height="15" class="thumbborder" data-file-width="600" data-file-height="400"> Kabul, Afghanistan
Details: May 2017 Kabul attack: A car bombing in Kabul's diplomatic quarter killed at least 150 persons and wounded more than 400 others.[172][173][174]

Location: <img alt="Kenya" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/49/Flag_of_Kenya.svg/23px-Flag_of_Kenya.svg.png" width="23" height="15" class="thumbborder" data-file-width="900" data-file-height="600"> Kiunga, Kenya
Details: Four police officer and a civilian were killed after a bomb exploded outside the town of Kiunga, Lamu County. Another seven people were injured in the blast. Al-Shabaab is being blamed for the attack.[175]
